result.execSummary:
The defendant Meghann E Collazo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $25 per month commencing 05-15-2015 and the 15th of each month thereafter or serve 3 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Meghann E Collazo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Meghann E Collazo in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Buttery.

Defendant has completed her community service.
State moves to amend to county ordinance of Theft.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid at the rate of $25 per month, starting 05/15/16 and the 15th of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  3 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Meghann E Collazo in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Buttery.

Defendant needs to complete 20 hours of Community Service in order to take advantage of the State's offer.
Defendant needs to complete an additional 9 hours to complete the 20 hour requirement.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
